required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Influence of Satiation Measures on the Portion Size Effect
clinical_study.official_title: Lunch Feeding Study for Men and Women

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to gain a better understanding of the satiation measures that influence human eating behavior in regard to intake of large portion sizes at a meal. The investigators hypothesize that satiation measures will influence the magnitude of the portion size effect at a meal. Additionally, other individual characteristics will be examined for their influence on the portion size effect. The portion size effect will be measured by serving a test meal once a week for four weeks in which the portion size of the entree will be varied.

primary_outcome.description: Calculated energy intake (kcal) based on weight and energy density of food consumed

secondary_outcome.description: The number of bites of the entree during the meal
Duration of the meal in seconds
Assessed from meal duration (seconds) and number of bites taken
Assessed from entree intake (grams) and number of bites
Assessed from entree intake (grams) and meal duration

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in distribution of estimated bite size
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed as small or large bites from video observation
The number of sips of the water during the meal

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of the pleasantness of the taste of the entree sample
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before the test meal to after the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from not at all pleasant (0 mm) to extremely pleasant (100 mm). This will be used to calculate Sensory-Specific Satiety

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of the pleasantness of the taste of food samples
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before the test meal to after the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from not at all pleasant (0 mm) to extremely pleasant (100 mm). This will be used to calculate Sensory-Specific Satiety

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of prospective consumption of the entree sample
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before the test meal to after the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from none at all (0 mm) to vary large amount (100 mm) in answer to the question 'How much of the pasta do you want to eat right now?'. This will be used to calculate Sensory-Specific Satiety

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in rating of prospective consumption of food samples
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before the test meal to after the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from none at all (0 mm) to vary large amount (100 mm) how much of the [this food] do you want to eat right now?. This will be used to calculate Sensory-Specific Satiety

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before the test meal to after the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from not at all hungry (0 mm) to extremely hungry (100 mm)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before the test meal to after the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from not at all thirsty (0 mm) to extremely thirsty (100 mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in ratings of prospective consumption
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before the test meal to after the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from nothing at all (0 mm) to a large amount (100 mm) in answer to the question 'How much food could you eat right now?'.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before the test meal to after the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from not at all nauseated (0 mm) to extremely nauseated (100 mm)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From before the test meal to after the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
secondary_outcome.description: Measured on a 100-mm visual analogue scale ranging from not at all full (0 mm) to extremely full (100 mm)

other_outcome.measure: Rating of the size of the entree compared to participants' usual portion
other_outcome.time_frame: At the start of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
other_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from a lot smaller to a lot larger

other_outcome.measure: Rating of how filling participants expect this amount of food to be
other_outcome.time_frame: At the start of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
other_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from not at all filling to extremely filling

other_outcome.measure: Rating of pleasantness of taste of entree
other_outcome.time_frame: At the start of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
other_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from not pleasant at all to extremely pleasant

other_outcome.measure: Ratings of Meal Termination due to fullness
other_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
other_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from strongly disagree to strongly agree

other_outcome.measure: Ratings of Meal Termination due to eating their usual amount
other_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
other_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from strongly disagree to strongly agree

other_outcome.measure: Ratings of Meal Termination due to eating is no longer a priority
other_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
other_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from strongly disagree to strongly agree

other_outcome.measure: Ratings of Meal Termination due to there being no food left
other_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
other_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from strongly disagree to strongly agree

other_outcome.measure: Ratings of Meal Termination due to self-consciousness about amount consumed
other_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
other_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from strongly disagree to strongly agree

other_outcome.measure: Ratings of Meal Termination due to the food no longer tasting good
other_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
other_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from strongly disagree to strongly agree

other_outcome.measure: Rating of proportion of meal eaten
other_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4
other_outcome.description: 100-point visual analog scale ranging from 0% to 100%

other_outcome.measure: Rating of calories consumed at the meal
other_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the test meal in weeks 1, 2, 3, 4

arm_group.description: Test meal with portion size 100% of baseline
Test meal with portion size 125% of baseline
Test meal with portion size 150% of baseline
Test meal with portion size 175% of baseline

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Be willing and able to travel to Penn State University Park campus weekly for meals
- Be a man or woman 18 - 70 years old
- Regularly eat 3 meals/day
- Be willing to avoid alcohol the day before and during test days
- Have a body mass index between 18.0 and 35.0 kg/m*m
- Be willing to refrain from eating after 10 pm the evening before test sessions
- Be willing to participate in all study procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Must not be a smoker
- Must not be an athlete in training
- Must not be pregnant or breastfeeding at the time of screening
- Have taken prescription or non-prescription drugs that may affect appetite or food intake within the last 3 months
- Dislike or be unable to eat the test foods (because of allergies, intolerance, or dietary restrictions)
- Must not be currently dieting to gain or lose weight
- Have a health condition that affects appetite
- Have participated in a similar study in our lab in the past year
- Must not be a student, faculty, or staff member in nutritional sciences or psychology

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor of Nutrition and Director of the Laboratory for the Study of Human Ingestive Behavior
